children.name: when a lot of people have an illness
epidemic
children.definition: when a lot of people in an area or country get a disease, and it spreads very quickly: dịch bệnh
examples: AIDS has become an epidemic in some countries.
Doctors warn that a flu epidemic may be on the way.
Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
epidemic of
an epidemic of cholera

children.name: outbreak
children.definition: when a lot of people suddenly start to get an illness at the same time: sự bùng phát

children.name: outbreak of
examples: Doctors are very concerned about an outbreak of tuberculosis in an East London School.

children.name: pandemic
children.definition: a pandemic disease: đại dịch
examples: a pandemicofinfluenza
an influenza pandemic
the AIDS pandemic

children.name: disease
children.definition: a particular illness that has amedicalname: căn bệnh
examples: The most common symptoms of the disease are a high temperature and spots all over the body.
Thousands of people in this area are dying from hunger and disease.
disease of
She suffers from a rare disease of the brain.
His father died of heart disease.
She contracted the disease while she was abroad on holiday.
commoncommon childhood diseases
seriousvaccines against serious diseases like hepatitis and meningitis

children.name: have a disease
examples: How long have you had the disease?

children.name: suffer from a disease
examples: About three million people suffer from the disease.

children.name: catch/get a disease
children.definition: alsocontract a diseaseformal
examples: He caught the disease while travelling in Africa.

children.name: develop a disease
examples: A few years ago, she developed a serious lung disease.

children.name: pass on a disease
children.definition: alsotransmit a diseaseformal
examples: They may pass the disease on to their children.

children.name: cause a disease
examples: Smoking is probably the major factor causing heart disease.

children.name: prevent a disease
examples: It has been claimed that fibre in the diet could help prevent many serious diseases.

children.name: treat a disease
examples: The disease can be treated with antibiotics.

children.name: cure a disease
examples: The plant was believed to cure diseases in humans and cattle.

children.name: fight
children.definition: a
examples: disease(= try to stop it continuing )Some bacteria help the human body fight disease.

children.name: a disease spreads
examples: The government have no idea how far the disease has spread.

children.name: rare
examples: She suffers from a rare bone disease.

children.name: fatal/deadly
children.definition: that causes death
examples: If left untreated, the disease can be fatal.|Thousands of children are struck down by this deadly disease every year.

children.name: incurable
children.definition: that cannot be cured
examples: Diseases that were once thought incurable can be treated with antibiotics.

children.name: infectious/contagious
children.definition: that spreads quickly from one person to another
examples: The disease is highly contagious.

children.name: a skin/brain/lung etc disease
examples: The fumes have caused skin diseases among the villagers.

children.name: heart/liver/kidney disease
examples: He is being treated for kidney disease.

children.name: a hereditary/inherited disease
children.definition: that is passed from parent to child
examples: Parents are offered screening for some hereditary diseases.

children.name: a sexually-transmitted disease
children.definition: that is spread by having sex
examples: There was a worrying rise in the number of sexually-transmitted diseases.

children.name: a degenerative disease
children.definition: that gradually gets worse
examples: She was suffering from a degenerative disease that confined her to a wheelchair.

children.name: a chronic disease
children.definition: continuing for a long time and not possible to cure
examples: Chronic disease is sometimes seen as an inevitable part of being old.

children.name: a cure for a disease
examples: There is no known cure for this disease.

children.name: an outbreak of a disease
children.definition: when a disease appears in a number of people or animals
examples: There has been an outbreak of the disease in Wales.

children.name: the spread of a disease
examples: Knowing the facts about AIDS can prevent the spread of the disease.

children.name: the symptoms of a disease
children.definition: physical signs that someone has a disease
examples: To begin with, there are often no symptoms of the disease.

children.name: problem
children.definition: sth that is wrong with a particular part of your body or your health in general:
examples: a serious back problem
health problems

children.name: illness
children.definition: a health problem that you are suffering from which makes you feel ill: đau ốm bệnh tật.
examples: She died yesterday after a long illness.

children.name: serious/severe
examples: His illness is more severe than the doctors first thought.

children.name: minor
children.definition: not serious
examples: He suffered a succession of minor illnesses.

children.name: fatal
children.definition: causing death quite quickly
examples: She developed a fatal illness.

children.name: life-threatening
children.definition: likely to cause death
examples: Doctors say that his illness isn’t life-threatening.

children.name: terminal
children.definition: causing death eventually, and not possible to cure
examples: At that point the illness was thought to be terminal.

children.name: incurable
children.definition: not possible to cure
examples: The films tells the sad story of a young boy with an incurable illness.

children.name: acute
children.definition: becoming serious very quickly
examples: A lot of illnesses can be either acute or chronic.

children.name: chronic
children.definition: that lasts a long time, and cannot be cured
examples: Diabetes is an example of a chronic illness.

children.name: a long/short illness
examples: She nursed him through his long illness.|Arthur died following a short illness.

children.name: a debilitating illness
children.definition: that makes you very weak
examples: His last years were ruined by a debilitating illness.

children.name: a childhood illness
examples: Measles is a common childhood illness.

children.name: a mental/psychiatric illness
examples: We provide specialist care for young people with mental illnesses.

children.name: have an illness
examples: When did you first find out that you had the illness?

children.name: suffer from an illness
examples: She suffers from a rare illness.

children.name: get/develop an illness
examples: She developed the illness when she was in her 50s.

children.name: contract an illnessformal
children.definition: get an illness by catching it from another person
examples: He contracted the illness while he was working abroad.

children.name: recover from an illness
examples: It took several months for him to recover from his illness.

children.name: be diagnosed with an illness
children.definition: be found by doctors to have an illness
examples: Her husband had just been diagnosed with a terminal illness.

children.name: the symptoms of an illness
examples: Symptoms of the illness include vomiting and severe headaches.

children.name: trouble
children.definition: illness or pain that affects a particular part of your body:
examples: I’ve had a bit of stomach trouble.

children.name: condition
children.definition: a problem that affects someone’s health permanently or over a long period of time: căn bệnh (kéo dài)

children.name: a medical condition such as asthma
examples: People with your condition should not smoke.

children.name: suffer from a condition
examples: Diane suffers from a rare heart condition which means she has to take drugs all the time.

children.name: disorder
children.definition: an illness that prevents part of your body from working properly or affects the way you behave, especially one that is permanent or continues for a long time: rối loại
examples: He suffers from a rare disorder of the liver.

children.name: a genetic disorder
children.definition: caused by a gene from your parents
examples: Progeria is a genetic disorder which accelerates ageing.

children.name: a mental/psychiatric/psychological disorder
children.definition: affecting the mind
examples: He was diagnosed with a severe psychiatric disorder.

children.name: a blood/brain/liver etc disorder
examples: She suffers from a rare brain disorder.

children.name: an eating disorder
children.definition: in which someone stops eating a normal amount of food
examples: Eating disorders can be very difficult to treat.

children.name: a personality disorder
children.definition: that stops someone behaving in a normal way
examples: The study suggested that 84% of prisoners have a personality disorder.

children.name: a common/rare disorder
examples: Acne is a very common skin disorder.

children.name: have a disorder
examples: The singer admitted she had an eating disorder.

children.name: suffer from a disorder
examples: People who are suffering from psychological disorders often fail to get treatment.

children.name: develop a disorder
examples: Women are 30% more likely to develop the disorder than men.

children.name: treat a disorder
examples: The drug is used to treat lung disorders.

children.name: a disorder affects somebody/something
examples: Many genetic disorders affect only girls or only boys.

children.name: a disorder of the brain/liver/digestive system etc
examples: The hospital specializes in treating disorders of the brain.

children.name: when a disease can not be cured
incurable
children.definition: không thể chữa, nan y
examples: My doctor told me that the cancer was incurable
incurable disease/illness/condition
She has a rare, incurable disease.
Patients with incurable illnesses are brought to the hospice, where they are given the best possible care.

children.name: chronic
children.definition: a chronic illness continues for a very long time or is permanent: mãn tính,kinh niên
examples: He suffers from chronic asthma.
chronic diseases/ conditions
chronic arthritis/pain
a chronic invalid

children.name: terminal
children.definition: a terminal illness is one that cannot be cured, and the person who has it will die from it: giai đoạn cuối
examples: Two years ago, his mother developed terminal cancer.
St Helen’s Hospice cares for people with terminal illnesses.
terminally[adv]
Her father is terminally ill.

children.name: the terminal stagesthe last stages of a disease that is killing themgiai đoạn cuối
examples: Many of the patients are in the terminal stages of the disease.

children.name: life-threatening
children.definition: a life-threatening disease is a very serious one that can cause death: hiểm nghèo
examples: life-threatening diseases such as cancer

children.name: attack
children.definition: when you suddenly begin to have an illness that you often have, especially when this only continues for a short time:
examples: Malaria often doesn’t go away completely, and a patient may suffer from repeated attacks over several years.

children.name: attack of
examples: One of my students suddenly had an attack of asthma and I didn’t know what to do.
I had a bad attack of flu at Christmas.
He died aftersufferinga severe asthmaattack.

children.name: a bout of
children.definition: a short period of suffering from an illness, especially one that is not serious: cơn bệnh
examples: In recent months he had had several bouts of flu.
The patient may experience bouts of nausea as a result of the treatment.

children.name: a touch of
children.definition: a short period of suffering from an illness that is not serious:
examples: It’s nothing serious -- just a touch of indigestion.
I feel like I’m getting a touch of flu.

children.name: an illness that is not very serious
bug
children.definition: an illness that people catch very easily from each other but that isnotveryserious: bệnh lây nhiễm
examples: Gemima’s been off school with a tummy bug this week.

children.name: a nasty/horrible bug
examples: It was a really nasty bug.

children.name: a stomach bug
children.definition: alsoa tummy bugmore informal
examples: He’s off school with a stomach bug.

children.name: a flu bug
examples: We’ve all had a horrible flu bug.

children.name: a 24-hour/2-day etc bug
examples: The doctor says it’s just a 24-hour bug.

children.name: have a bug
examples: Two of us had a nasty bug on holiday.

children.name: catch/get a bug
examples: Six out of ten travellers get a stomach bug abroad.

children.name: pick up a bug
children.definition: catch one
examples: He seems to pick up every bug going.

children.name: a bug is going around
children.definition: a lot of people have it
examples: A lot of staff are off because there’s a bug going round.

children.name: ailment
children.definition: n illness that affects a particular part of your body, especially one that is not serious: ốm
examples: The medicine was supposed to cure all kinds of ailments, ranging from colds to back pains.
The most commonly reported ailment among VDU operators is eye-strain.

children.name: minor ailmentốm vặt
examples: Patients who often complain of minor ailments might have something more important on their minds.

children.name: complaint
children.definition: medicalan illness that affects a particular part of your body, especially one that is not very serious - used especially by doctors or in medical books: căn bệnh; chứng bệnh
examples: The cream is normally used for treating minor skin complaints.
Hay fever is a common complaint in spring and summer.

children.name: a minor skin complaint
examples: Deakin suffers from a back complaint called arachnoiditis.

children.name: infection
children.definition: a disease that affects a particular part of your body and is caused by bacteria or a virus: bệnh truyền nhiễm
examples: The baby had an ear infection.
If you don’t clean the wound properly you could get an infection.
infection of/ in
an infection of the bladder

children.name: serious/severe
examples: He was admitted to hospital with a serious infection.

children.name: slight/minor
children.definition: not serious
examples: She’s suffering from a slight infection.

children.name: nastyinformal
children.definition: a serious infection
examples: He’s got a really nasty infection.

children.name: acutemedical
children.definition: a serious infection that develops suddenly
examples: The disease usually occurs as an acute infection of the throat.

children.name: an ear/eye infection
examples: She was given antibiotics for an ear infection.

children.name: a chest infection
children.definition: an infection in the lungs
examples: I’ve got a bad cough, but the doctor says it isn’t a chest infection.

children.name: a throat/kidney etc infection
examples: He developed a severe throat infection.

children.name: a bacterial/viral/fungal infection
children.definition: caused by bacteria, a virus, or a fungus
examples: Antibiotics are not effective against viral infections.

children.name: a secondary infectionmedical
children.definition: an additional infection that happens as a result of the main illness
examples: Often, scratching the skin because it is itchy results in secondary infection.

children.name: have an infection
examples: I think you’ve got an infection, so you need to rest.

children.name: suffer from an infection
examples: He was suffering from an infection of the lungs.

children.name: get/ develop an infection
examples: She got a nasty throat infection which meant she couldn’t sing.

children.name: treat an infection
examples: Antibiotics are used to treat the infection.

children.name: fight/combat an infection
examples: A new drug is being developed to combat the infection.

children.name: spread an infection
children.definition: alsotransmit an infectionformal
examples: Pregnant women can transmit the infection to their unborn child.

children.name: an infection spreads
examples: The infection spread to her chest.

children.name: an infection clears up
children.definition: goes away
examples: Although the infection cleared up, he still felt weak.

children.name: be exposed to an infection
examples: He was exposed to the infection while he was travelling in India.

children.name: the source of an infection
examples: Doctors are trying to locate the source of the infection.

children.name: virus
children.definition: a disease caused by a virus: bệnh gây ra bởi virus
examples: I don't know exactly what's wrong with her - I think it's some sort of virus.
It is estimated that over thirty million people are now infected with the virus.

children.name: when a disease can be cured
acute
children.definition: an acute illness or disease quickly becomes very seriousOPP chronic: cấp tính
examples: acute abdominal pains
an acuteattackof appendicitis
acute arthritis

children.name: curable
children.definition: an illness that is curable can be curedOPP incurable: chữa được
examples: Many illnesses which once killed are today curable.

children.name: dose
children.definition: an amount or experience of an disease: trận
examples: She's got a nasty doseofflu.

children.name: a bad/mild dose of fluBritish English(= making you feel very ill or only slightly ill )
examples: Davehad a bad dose of flu.

children.name: industrial disease
children.definition: an illness related to the work that sb does: bệnh nghề nghiệp
examples: he had an asbestos-related industrial disease
the coroner recorded a verdict of death by industrial disease

children.name: complication
children.definition: an extra medical problem which makes it more difficult to treat an existing illness: biến chứng
examples: If there are no complications, the doctor says that she'll be able to come home within two weeks.
